body_html:
We need a closure so that eager.context and all the other modules are loaded.
Otherwise, you would get errors like context is None.

I'll try to dig into this issue before Monday or should I just try a simpler test to fix this issue and investigate the eager context issue after?

EDIT: We still need a local import for the closure, but it works with a lambda. When we clone the model to create an estimator, the environment of the function is not saved. So probably a bug in the get_config of Lambda.

Otherwise, you would get errors like context is None.
I'll try to dig into this issue before Monday or should I just try a simpler test to fix this issue and investigate the eager context issue after?
EDIT: We still need a local import for the closure, but it works with a lambda. When we clone the model to create an estimator, the environment of the function is not saved. So probably a bug in the get_config of Lambda.
body:
We need a closure so that eager.context and all the other modules are loaded.
Otherwise, you would get errors like context is None.

I'll try to dig into this issue before Monday or should I just try a simpler test to fix this issue and investigate the eager context issue after?

EDIT: We still need a local import for the closure, but it works with a lambda. When we clone the model to create an estimator, the environment of the function is not saved. So probably a bug in the get_config of Lambda.
